thread.title: CLIPPERS: Mbah a Moute finds fit in an unexpected place
thread.title_full: CLIPPERS: Mbah a Moute finds fit in an unexpected place - Press Enterprise

author: DAN WOIKE
title: CLIPPERS: Mbah a Moute finds fit in an unexpected place
text:
By DAN WOIKE / STAFF WRITER
Published: Oct. 25, 2015 Updated: 7:18 p.m. CLIPPERS: Mbah a Moute finds fit in an unexpected place Print Photo Share Pin It More Galleries ADVERTISEMENT The Clippers' Luc Richard Mbah a Moute, right, who has claimed the team's final roster spot, fouls the Warriors' Ian Clark in an exhibition game last week at Staples Center. JAE C. HONG , THE ASSOCIATED PRESS Related article » PLAYA VISTA â" Luc Mbah a Moute surveyed the NBA landscape, looking at his options, trying to find the right staff with the right team â" the right situation for him.
This is what free agents do all over the NBA, and Mbah a Moute thought he found the fit.
It wasnât the Clippers. It was Sacramento.
But through a bizarre series of events, Mbah a Moute didnât get the team he wanted, instead finding himself starting the season without a clear path for minutes on the Clippers, an NBA title contender.
âThings usually work out one way or another and usually not how you expect it,â he said before the Clippersâ practice Sunday. âIâm just glad for the opportunity to be on this team. This team has a chance to be something special, and to be a part of it would be special. Iâm glad it worked out for me.â
Mbah a Moute secured the Clippersâ final available roster spot, beating out veteran forward Chuck Hayes.
Clippers head coach and president of basketball operations Doc Rivers didnât pull Mbah a Moute to the side to let him know he made the team. Rivers said nothing, and in this case, the silence was the good news.
âThey didnât tell me I was gone â¦ so I just show up for work,â Mbah a Moute said with a grin. âThey didnât tell me I canât be here anymore, so Iâm here.â
Rivers said the decision came down to Mbah a Mouteâs presence on one end of the floor.
âI just think he can defend,â Rivers said. âHeâs one of those guys that can be a great team defender.â
Mbah a Mouteâs deal becomes guaranteed for the entire season Jan.10.
He ended up with the Clippers after the Kings voided Mbah a Mouteâs deal with the team, claiming he failed his physical because of a shoulder injury.
âI mean, Iâve been healthy,â he said. âItâs never been a limitation for me. You have to go ask the people at Sacramento.â
However, Mbah a Moute and the players union filed a grievance against the Kings, and following arbitration in September, the two sides are negotiating.
âThereâs a reason I picked Sacramento,â Mbah a Moute said. âI felt like it was going to be a good situation for me. Iâm not glad it happened, but in life, you canât control everything that happens. You can control what you can do. Iâm glad I fell here, and Iâm excited about this team and the season to come.â
